snippet: In the 15 months ended July 1, 2011, New York City gained nearly 70,000 residents, bolstering city officials’ claims that thousands of people in Brooklyn and Queens were undercounted in the 2010 census.
abstract: Census estimates show that New York City gained nearly 70,000 residents in the 15 months ended July 1, 2011, almost matching the record growth of the 1990s and appearing to outpace growth suggested by the 2010 census.
lead_paragraph: In the 15 months ended July 1, 2011, New York City gained nearly 70,000 residents, bolstering city officials’ claims that thousands of people in Brooklyn and Queens were undercounted in the 2010 census.

headline.seo: Census Estimates for 2011 Show Population Growth in New York
headline.main: Population Growth in New York City Is Outpacing 2010 Census, 2011 Estimates Show
headline.print_headline: Population Growth in New York City Is Outpacing 2010 Census, 2011 Estimates Show
